comment: Charcoal, mellow, nice burn. Like original better by just a touch.
It's okay. Not as bad as 'snobs' make it out to be, but not the best. A good compromise and not too hash for the new drinker.
Not a huge JD fan but this is very smooth and a bit more refined than regular Jack.

Nose: maple, brown sugar and spice with underlying charred wood and citrus 

Taste: it starts off as a slightly medicinal caramel, then moves to some charcoal and light vanilla. 

Finish: sweetness gives way to almost an oily wood and corn. Long finish and pretty dry.
Il y a un arrièrre goût étrange. Je ne sais pas exactement ce que c'est, mais ce n'est pas à mon goût.
